responsibilities: Design and develop electrical systems for camera hardware, including PCBs, power management, and sensor integration.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of cameras with other hardware and software components.
Perform functional, performance, and environmental testing on camera systems to validate designs.
Debug and troubleshoot electrical issues, including power supply, signal integrity, and EMI/EMC concerns.
Develop test setups and procedures to validate hardware performance and compliance with industry standards.
Optimize electrical designs for manufacturability, reliability, and cost efficiency.
Document designs, test results, and troubleshooting processes to support product development and manufacturing.
qualifications: Experience with high-speed data interfaces such as MIPI, USB, or Ethernet.
Knowledge of thermal management in electronic systems.
Familiarity with scripting languages like Python for test automation and data analysis.
Understanding of camera optics and image signal processing is a plus.
analysis: The job responsibilities focus on designing and developing electrical systems for camera hardware, including tasks such as PCB design, power management, sensor integration, and testing for performance and compliance. The skills required include experience with high-speed data interfaces, thermal management, scripting for test automation, and an understanding of camera optics and image signal processing. There is no mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The job is centered around hardware design and testing, rather than software development or AI model training and deployment.
